page.title: 19Rural recreation
page.content: There are no public playing fields or sports centres in the area, and most people who wish to play games such as football, tennis, or squash, or who wish to swim, have to travel to the nearby towns. Some families, however, have their own swimming pools and tennis courts. Most people find their recreation in or near their homes in activities such as shooting, gardening, needlework, and knitting. Some people have taken up painting and learning to play the organ. At only one place was it stated there was no time for recreation. Two fox hunts, North Hereford and Clifton on Teme, operate across this block, many people following on horseback, others on foot as far as they are able. Local children are able to join scouts and guides in Bromyard. There is a mobile library and a larger one in Bromyard.
